Item 5.02 - Departure of Directors or Ce.content: On March 8, 2024, the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors of NVIDIA Corporation adopted the Variable Compensation Plan for Fiscal Year 2025 (the 2025 Plan).

subsections.plan_details: The 2025 Plan provides eligible executive officers the opportunity to earn a variable cash payment based on the level of achievement by the Company of certain corporate performance goals during fiscal year 2025. The Company's fiscal year 2025 ends on January 26, 2025.
subsections.performance_goals: The Compensation Committee has set the Performance Goals for fiscal year 2025 based upon the achievement of specified fiscal year 2025 revenue and has established threshold compensation plan, base compensation plan, and stretch compensation plan levels.
subsections.eligibility: Unless otherwise determined by the Compensation Committee, a participant must remain an employee through the payment date under the 2025 Plan to be eligible to earn an award.
subsections.named_executive_officer_awards:
The following table sets forth the respective target award opportunities for base compensation plan achievement for the Company’s named executive officers under the 2025 Plan:
- Jen-Hsun Huang, President and Chief Executive Officer: Target Award Opportunity $3,000,000 (200% of Fiscal Year 2025 Base Salary)
- Colette M. Kress, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer: Target Award Opportunity $300,000 (33% of Fiscal Year 2025 Base Salary)
- Ajay K. Puri, Executive Vice President, Worldwide Field Operations: Target Award Opportunity $650,000 (68% of Fiscal Year 2025 Base Salary)
- Debora Shoquist, Executive Vice President, Operations: Target Award Opportunity $250,000 (29% of Fiscal Year 2025 Base Salary)
- Timothy S. Teter, Executive Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary: Target Award Opportunity $250,000 (29% of Fiscal Year 2025 Base Salary)
subsections.exhibit_reference: The foregoing description is subject to, and qualified in its entirety by, the 2025 Plan, which is filed with this report as Exhibit 10.1 and is incorporated herein by reference.

Item 5.03 - Amendments to Articles of In.content: On March 12, 2024, the Board of the Company amended and restated the Company’s Bylaws, which became effective immediately upon adoption by the Board.

subsections.summary_of_amendments:
The amendments effected by the Restated Bylaws include:
• Permitting stockholders of record owning at least 15% of the voting power of all then-outstanding shares of voting stock, who have owned such shares continuously for at least one year, to call a special meeting of stockholders, subject to certain requirements.
• Eliminating the requirement that a list of stockholders be made available at stockholder meetings to conform to recent amendments to the Delaware General Corporation Law.
• Incorporating certain technical, clarifying and conforming changes.
subsections.exhibit_reference: The foregoing summary of the amendments effected by the Restated Bylaws does not purport to be complete and is qualified in its entirety by reference to the complete text of the Restated Bylaws, a copy of which is filed as Exhibit 3.1 hereto and incorporated herein by reference.
